qas.question: Where is Ross music extremely popular?

plausible_answers.text: Artists and groups such as Madonna, Janet Jackson, Paula Abdul, Aretha Franklin

qas.question: Who incorporated Chicago music into some of their work?

context: In the late 1980s, many local Chicago house music artists suddenly found themselves presented with major label deals. House music proved to be a commercially successful genre and <a3_0><b7_0>a more mainstream pop-based variation<b7_0/><a3_0/> grew increasingly popular. <b8_0>Artists and groups such as Madonna, Janet Jackson, Paula Abdul, Aretha Franklin<b8_0/>, Bananarama, Diana Ross, Tina Turner, Whitney Houston, Steps, Kylie Minogue, Bjork, and C+C Music Factoryhave all incorporated the genre into some of their work. After enjoying significant success in the early to mid-90s, house music grew even larger during the second wave of progressive house (<a0_0><b4_0>1999–2001<b4_0/><a0_0/>). The genre has remained popular and fused into other popular subgenres, for example, <a1_0><b5_0>G-house, Deep House, Tech House and Bass House<b5_0/><a1_0/>. As of 2015, house music remains extremely popular in <a2_0><b6_0>both clubs and in the mainstream pop scene<b6_0/><a2_0/> while retaining a foothold on underground scenes across the globe.[citation needed]
